infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class EntropyCalculatorGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.EntropyCalculatorGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntropyCalculator, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous

    public class EntropyCalculatorGaussian
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntropyCalculator

    Computes the differential entropy of a given set of observations (implementing EntropyCalculator, assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is Gaussian.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for EntropyCalculator, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to EntropyCalculatorGaussian().
    • The user can call setVariance(double) instead of supplying observations via setObservations(double[]).
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    • Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables defined at MathWorld
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(double[] observations)
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculator
        Sets the samples from which to compute the PDF for the entropy. Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface EntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        observations - array of (univariate) samples

        Parameters:

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the entropy from the previously supplied observations, or based on the supplied variance.

        The entropy for a Gaussian-distribution random variable with variance \sigma is 0.5*\log_e{2*pi*e*\sigma}.

        Here we compute the entropy assuming that the recorded estimation of the variance is correct (i.e. we will not make a bias correction for limited observations here).

        Specified by:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the entropy of the previously provided observations or from the supplied covariance matrix. Entropy returned in nats, not bits!

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculator
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations.

        Specified by:
        computeLocalOfPreviousObservations in interface EntropyCalculator
        Returns:
        the array of local entropy values corresponding to each previously supplied observation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if setVariance(double) was used previously instead of #setObservations(double[][])

      • getNumObservations

        public int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Specified by:
        getNumObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
